info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:58PM EDT until August 12 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN POLK...GREENVILLE...NORTHWESTERN SPARTANBURG... NORTHEASTERN ANDERSON AND EAST CENTRAL PICKENS COUNTIES... At 558 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles south of Columbus to 5 miles south of Easley, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Easley, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Berea and Five Forks. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
